“哥特复兴（gothic revival）”(Gothic Revival)建筑的造型和细部都仿自中世纪的哥特(Gothic)风格。与“古典复兴”(Classical Revival)建筑注重理性、但外观.

entry.tran: 复苏;复兴;恢复;再次流行
entry.def: When there is a revival of something, it becomes active or popular again.

example.ex: This return to realism has produced a revival of interest in a number of artists...
example.tran: 这种重回现实主义的趋势已经重新激起了人们对许多艺术家的兴趣。

example.ex: There is little chance of a revival in new car sales until at least August next year.
example.tran: 至少到明年8月之前，新车销量回升的希望都微乎其微。

entry.tran: (戏剧、歌剧或芭蕾等的)重新上演
entry.def: A revival is a new production of a play, an opera, or a ballet.

example.tran: 约翰·克莱门特对于契诃夫的《海鸥》的重新演绎

entry.tran: （复兴基督教信仰的）奋兴布道会
entry.def: A revival meeting is a public religious event that is intended to make people more interested in Christianity.

example.ex: He toured South Africa organizing revival meetings.
example.tran: 他游历南非，组织奋兴布道会。

means.word_mean: 1. bringing again into activity and prominence;

sentences.sentence: "a revival of a neglected play by Moliere"

means.word_mean: 2. an evangelistic meeting intended to reawaken interest in religion

stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+viv生命+ial……的→共同活跃的→欢乐的
vi=viv生命+able能……的→adj.可行的,能活下去的
viv生命+acious多……的→多生命的→活泼的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 鲜艳的;生动的,栩栩如生的
stems_affixes.word_buile: viv生命+id……的→adj.鲜艳的;生动的,栩栩如生的
revive[v.恢复;[使]复苏]+al表名词→n.复苏,再生
survive幸免于+al状态→经过事故活着→幸存
sur超过+viv生命+e→活下来了→幸免于

means.word_mean: 复活, 再生;复兴, 再流行

sentences.en: The period saw a great revival in the wine trade.
sentences.cn: 这一时期葡萄酒业出现了很大的复苏。

sentences.en: He claimed the housing market was showing signs of a revival.
sentences.cn: 他指出房地产市场正出现复苏的迹象。

sentences.en: The revival of the railway service will be immensely beneficial for the speedy movement of passengers and cargo.
sentences.cn: 铁路运输的复兴对加快客货运送大有助益。
